Triple witching refers to the simultaneous expiration of 3 types of derivative contracts on the same day: Stock index futures
Stock index options
Individual stock options
Only 4 times/year, on the third Friday of March, June, Sept & December.

Social media has been a fun, interesting & an unexpected journey over the years which offered a lot of global connections and opportunities, I even met my wife through here!

But I've decided my online presence has come to an end. Life is short & truth be told I love the real world way more.üòâ

In January 2024 I put out the cynic's guide to markets. 
$SPX was trading just below 4800 and in the article I had outlined all my reasons for its conclusion:
"The cynic‚Äôs guide to markets strongly suggests that volatility will again get restrained and corrections will again get bought and big new highs will come in 2025".
This has been our trading bible in the last 2 years and I submit, irrespective of how the market closes into year end, this script has indeed played again for this 5th year of the 10 year cycle.

Daily Market Brief:
northmantrader.com/2025/12/1‚Ä¶
Now even the top of the k-shaped economy is complaining about affordability!

2/2

This list should have sparked a bond rally, but it is not.
When markets cannot rally on good news (falling yields for bonds), it is a signal.
--
* Dec 10 - The Fed cuts 25 bps, bringing the total cuts to 175 bps since September 2024 - BULLISH FOR BONDS

* Dec 10 - During his press conference, Chairman Powell said: ‚ÄúPayroll jobs averaging 40,000 per month since April. We think there‚Äôs an overstatement in ‚Äî in these numbers by about 60,000. So that would be negative 20,000 per month.‚Äù - INCREDIBLY BULLISH FOR BONDS

* Dec 16 - Employment report, October payrolls down 105k, November unemployment 4.6%, a new cyclical high. - BULLISH FOR BONDS

* Dec 18 - CPI missed expectations. Core CPI 2.6%, lowest since 2021 - BULLISH FOR BONDS

* Since Dec 10, the national average for gasoline prices is down 3+% to $2.88, the lowest since mid-2021. - INCREDIBLY BULLISH FOR BONDS

1/2

The US 30-year yield over the last few weeks.

The red line starts at the close on December 9th, the day before the Fed meeting.

The news for bonds has been very bullish the last two weeks (detailed next), but bonds yields are higher!
The Japanese 10-year yield just hit its highest level this century.

3/4

And they are expected to aggressively hike throughout 2026.

2/4

So it should be no surprise the BoJ will hike rates later today at its Monetary Policy meeting.

As this chart shows. the market is pricing more than a 90% probability they will hike today.

Meta sits at the center of the AI spending debate, as Big Tech continues to shock markets with outsized AI capex. 

Yet what the market is overlooking is that Meta is already reporting $60B in AI-driven ARR, second only to Nvidia and showcasing a long-awaited ROI from the AI data center buildout.

$META $NVDA 
io-fund.com/ai-stocks/ai-rev‚Ä¶

AI coding startup Lovable has raised $330 million in a fresh funding round featuring participation from Google and Nvidia's VC arms, valuing Lovable at $6.6 billion, up more than 3.5X from its previous $1.8 billion valuation from July.

$NVDA $GOOG

You will not believe which stock is #2 in AI revenue - second only to $NVDA.

Link in bio for full analysis.

OpenAI has reportedly discussed raising as much as $100 billion in funds at a $750 billion valuation, which, if it materializes, would represent a 50% increase from its $500 billion valuation in October. 

$MSFT $AMZN $GOOG $ORCL $NVDA

The global server market rose 61% YoY to $112.4B in Q3, per IDC, with strong AI demand driving growth. YTD server revenue has reached $312.4 billion. 

$NVDA $AMD $SMCI $DELL
